content_tree.heading: Churros
content_tree.content:
   Ingredients :
o   1 cup water  o   1/2 cup butter  o   1 cup flour  o   3 eggs  o   1/4 cup sugar  o   1 teaspoon cinnamon  o   Oil for frying     Instructions :
o   Bring water and butter to a boil.  o   Add flour and stir until a dough forms.  o   Remove from heat and beat in eggs one at a time.  o   Heat oil in a pan.  o   Pipe dough into hot oil and fry until golden.  o   Drain on paper towels and roll in a mixture of sugar and cinnamon.  o   Serve warm.    Coconut Rice
   Ingredients :
o   1 cup rice  o   1 cup coconut milk  o   1 cup water  o   1/4 cup shredded coconut  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Sauté shredded coconut until lightly browned.  o   Add rice, coconut milk, water, and salt.  o   Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender.  o   Serve warm.    Coleslaw
   Ingredients :
o   1 small cabbage  o   2 carrots  o   1/2 cup mayonnaise  o   2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar  o   1 tablespoon sugar  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Shred cabbage and grate carrots.  o   Mix mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, and salt in a bowl.  o   Toss cabbage and carrots with dressing.  o   Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

content_tree.heading: Cornbread
content_tree.content:
   Ingredients :
o   1 cup cornmeal  o   1 cup flour  o   1/4 cup sugar  o   1 tablespoon baking powder  o   1/2 teaspoon salt  o   1 cup milk  o   1/4 cup vegetable oil  o   1 egg     Instructions :
o   Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).  o   Mix cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.  o   Add milk, oil, and beaten egg, stir until combined.  o   Pour batter into a greased baking pan.  o   Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden.  o   Serve warm.    Coxinha
   Ingredients :
o   2 cups shredded chicken  o   1 small onion  o   2 cloves garlic  o   1/4 cup parsley  o   1/4 cup cream cheese  o   1 cup flour  o   1 cup breadcrumbs  o   2 eggs  o   Oil for frying     Instructions :
o   Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.  o   Mix shredded chicken with onion, garlic, chopped parsley, and cream cheese.  o   Form mixture into drumstick shapes.  o   Dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs.  o   Fry in hot oil until golden.  o   Drain on paper towels and serve warm.    Croque Monsieur
   Ingredients :
o   8 slices bread  o   4 slices ham  o   1 cup grated Gruyère cheese  o   1/4 cup béchamel sauce
o   2 tablespoons butter     Instructions :
o   Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).  o   Spread béchamel sauce on 4 slices of bread.  o   Top with ham and grated cheese, then cover with remaining bread slices.  o   Melt butter in a pan and toast sandwiches until golden.  o   Transfer to a baking sheet, top with more béchamel sauce and cheese.  o   Bake for 10 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.  o   Serve warm.    Croquetas
   Ingredients :
o   1/2 cup butter  o   1/2 cup flour  o   2 cups milk  o   1/2 cup ham  o   1/4 cup grated cheese  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   1/2 teaspoon nutmeg  o   1 cup breadcrumbs  o   2 eggs  o   Oil for frying     Instructions :
o   Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in flour to make a roux.  o   Gradually add milk, stirring constantly until thickened.  o   Stir in diced ham, grated cheese, salt, and nutmeg.  o   Let mixture cool, then form into croquettes.  o   Dredge croquettes in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs.  o   Fry in hot oil until golden.  o   Drain on paper towels and serve warm.    Dal Tadka
   Ingredients :
o   1 cup lentils  o   4 cups water  o   1 small onion  o   2 cloves garlic  o   1 teaspoon cumin  o   1 teaspoon turmeric  o   1 teaspoon coriander  o   1 teaspoon garam masala  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   2 tablespoons oil     Instructions :
o   Rinse lentils and cook in water until tender.  o   Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent.  o   Add cumin, turmeric, coriander, and garam masala, cook for 1 minute.  o   Add cooked lentils and stir to combine.  o   Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.  o   Add salt to taste and serve.    Deviled Eggs
   Ingredients :
o   6 eggs  o   1/4 cup mayonnaise  o   1 tablespoon mustard  o   1 tablespoon vinegar  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   1/2 teaspoon paprika     Instructions :
o   Hard-boil eggs, then peel and halve.  o   Remove yolks and mash with mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, and salt.  o   Spoon or pipe yolk mixture into egg whites.  o   Sprinkle with paprika and serve.    Dolmas
   Ingredients :
o   1 jar grape leaves  o   1 cup rice  o   1 small onion  o   1/4 cup pine nuts  o   1/4 cup currants  o   1/4 cup lemon juice  o   1/4 cup olive oil  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Rinse grape leaves and pat dry.  o   Sauté diced onion in olive oil until translucent.  o   Add rice, pine nuts, and currants, cook for 5 minutes.  o   Add 1 cup water, lemon juice, and salt, simmer until rice is tender.  o   Place a spoonful of rice mixture on each grape leaf and roll tightly.  o   Arrange dolmas in a pot, cover with water, and simmer for 30 minutes.  o   Serve warm or chilled.    Dumplings
   Ingredients :
o   1 package dumpling wrappers  o   1/2 pound ground pork
o   1/2 cup chopped cabbage  o   1/4 cup chopped green onions  o   2 cloves garlic  o   1 tablespoon soy sauce  o   1 teaspoon sesame oil  o   Oil for frying     Instructions :
o   Mix ground pork, cabbage, green onions, minced garlic, soy sauce, and sesame
oil in a bowl.  o   Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and fold to seal.  o   Fry in hot oil until golden, then steam for 5 minutes.  o   Serve with dipping sauce.    Edamame
   Ingredients :
o   1 pound edamame (soybeans in pods)  o   1 tablespoon sea salt     Instructions :
o   Steam or boil edamame until tender (about 5 minutes).  o   Drain and sprinkle with sea salt.  o   Serve warm.    Egusi Soup
   Ingredients :
o   1 cup ground egusi seeds  o   1/2 pound beef  o   1/2 pound fish  o   1 small onion  o   2 cloves garlic  o   4 tomatoes  o   1/4 cup palm oil  o   1 teaspoon crayfish powder  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   1/2 teaspoon pepper  o   4 cups water  o   1/4 cup spinach     Instructions :
o   Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in palm oil until softened.  o   Add diced tomatoes, ground egusi seeds, and crayfish powder, cook for 5
minutes.  o   Add beef, fish, salt, pepper, and water, simmer until meat is tender.  o   Stir in chopped spinach and cook for 5 minutes.  o   Serve warm.

content_tree.heading: Egg Rolls
content_tree.content:
   Ingredients :
o   1 package egg roll wrappers  o   1 cup shredded cabbage  o   1/2 cup grated carrots  o   1/2 cup bean sprouts  o   1/4 cup chopped green onions  o   2 tablespoons soy sauce  o   1 tablespoon sesame oil  o   Oil for frying     Instructions :
o   Mix cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts, green onions, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a
bowl.  o   Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and roll tightly.  o   Fry in hot oil until golden.  o   Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce.    Elote
   Ingredients :
o   4 ears of corn  o   1/4 cup mayonnaise  o   1/4 cup sour cream  o   1/2 cup cotija cheese  o   1 teaspoon chili powder  o   1 lime     Instructions :
o   Grill the corn until charred.  o   Mix mayonnaise and sour cream in a bowl.  o   Brush the mixture onto the corn.  o   Sprinkle with cotija cheese and chili powder.  o   Squeeze lime juice over the top and serve.    Empanadas
   Ingredients :
o   2 cups flour  o   1/2 cup butter  o   1/4 cup water  o   1 egg  o   1/2 pound ground beef  o   1 small onion  o   2 cloves garlic  o   1/4 cup olives  o   1/4 cup raisins  o   1 teaspoon cumin
o   1 teaspoon paprika  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   Oil for frying     Instructions :
o   Mix flour, butter, water, and beaten egg to form a dough, then let rest.  o   Sauté ground beef, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped olives, and raisins with
cumin, paprika, and salt until cooked.  o   Roll out dough and cut into circles.  o   Place a spoonful of filling on each circle and fold to seal.  o   Fry in hot oil until golden.  o   Drain on paper towels and serve warm.    Escalivada
   Ingredients :
o   2 eggplants  o   2 bell peppers  o   2 tomatoes  o   1 small onion  o   1/4 cup olive oil  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).  o   Roast eggplants, bell peppers, tomatoes, and onion until tender.  o   Peel and slice vegetables.  o   Arrange on a plate and drizzle with olive oil.  o   Sprinkle with salt and serve warm or at room temperature.    Falafel
   Ingredients :
o   1 can chickpeas  o   1 small onion  o   2 cloves garlic  o   1/4 cup parsley  o   1 teaspoon cumin  o   1 teaspoon coriander  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   1/4 cup flour  o   Oil for frying     Instructions :
o   Drain and rinse chickpeas.  o   Blend chickpeas, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, cumin, coriander,
and salt in a food processor.  o   Add flour and mix until combined.  o   Form mixture into balls and fry in hot oil until golden.
o   Drain on paper towels and serve.    Farofa
   Ingredients :
o   2 cups cassava flour  o   1/4 cup butter  o   1 small onion  o   2 cloves garlic  o   1/4 cup bacon  o   1/4 cup parsley  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Sauté diced bacon, onion, and minced garlic in butter until crispy.  o   Add cassava flour and cook, stirring constantly, until golden.  o   Stir in chopped parsley and salt.  o   Serve warm.    Fattoush
   Ingredients :
o   2 pita breads  o   4 tomatoes  o   1 cucumber  o   1 small red onion  o   1/4 cup parsley  o   1/4 cup mint  o   1/4 cup lemon juice  o   1/4 cup olive oil  o   1 teaspoon sumac  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Toast pita breads until crispy, then break into pieces.  o   Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion.  o   Mix vegetables with chopped parsley and mint.  o   Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, sumac, and salt, then pour over salad.  o   Toss well and serve.    Fava
   Ingredients :
o   1 cup yellow split peas  o   1 small onion  o   2 cloves garlic  o   1/4 cup olive oil  o   1/4 cup lemon juice  o   1 teaspoon salt
   Instructions :
o   Rinse split peas and cook in water until tender.  o   Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened.  o   Blend cooked peas with onion, garlic, lemon juice, and salt until smooth.  o   Serve warm or chilled.    Feijão Tropeiro
   Ingredients :
o   2 cups cooked beans  o   1/4 cup bacon  o   1 small onion  o   2 cloves garlic  o   1/4 cup cassava flour  o   1/4 cup parsley  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Sauté diced bacon, onion, and minced garlic until crispy.  o   Add cooked beans and cassava flour, stir to combine.  o   Stir in chopped parsley and salt.  o   Serve warm.    Festival
   Ingredients :
o   2 cups flour  o   1/4 cup cornmeal  o   1/4 cup sugar  o   1 tablespoon baking powder  o   1/2 teaspoon salt  o   1/4 cup milk  o   Oil for frying     Instructions :
o   Mix flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.  o   Add milk and stir until dough forms.  o   Roll out dough and cut into strips.  o   Fry in hot oil until golden.  o   Drain on paper towels and serve warm.    Focaccia
   Ingredients :
o   2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast  o   1 teaspoon sugar  o   1 cup warm water  o   2 1/2 cups flour  o   1 teaspoon salt
o   1/4 cup olive oil  o   Rosemary  o   Sea salt     Instructions :
o   Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy.  o   Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture and olive oil.  o   Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled.  o   Press dough into a baking pan, dimple with fingers, and sprinkle with rosemary
and sea salt.  o   Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes until golden.    Freekeh Salad
   Ingredients :
o   1 cup freekeh  o   2 cups water  o   1 small onion  o   1/4 cup parsley  o   1/4 cup mint  o   1/4 cup lemon juice  o   1/4 cup olive oil  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Rinse freekeh and cook in water until tender, then drain.  o   Sauté diced onion in olive oil until softened.  o   Mix freekeh with sautéed onion, chopped parsley, and mint.  o   Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, and salt, then pour over salad.  o   Toss well and serve.    Fried Plantains
   Ingredients :
o   2 ripe plantains  o   1 cup vegetable oil  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Peel and slice plantains.  o   Heat oil in a pan and fry plantain slices until golden.  o   Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt.  o   Serve warm.    Fried Rice
   Ingredients :
o   2 cups cooked rice  o   1 small onion  o   1/2 cup peas
o   1/2 cup diced carrots  o   2 eggs  o   2 tablespoons soy sauce  o   1 tablespoon sesame oil  o   1/4 cup chopped green onions     Instructions :
o   Sauté diced onion, peas, and carrots in sesame oil until softened.  o   Push vegetables to the side and scramble eggs in the same pan.  o   Add cooked rice and soy sauce, stir to combine.  o   Cook until heated through.  o   Garnish with chopped green onions and serve.    Fufu
   Ingredients :
o   2 cups cassava flour  o   4 cups water     Instructions :
o   Bring water to a boil.  o   Gradually add cassava flour, stirring constantly until thickened.  o   Continue to cook, stirring, until smooth and elastic.  o   Serve warm.    Gamja Jorim
   Ingredients :
o   4 potatoes  o   1/4 cup soy sauce  o   2 tablespoons sugar  o   1 tablespoon sesame oil  o   1/4 cup water  o   1 tablespoon sesame seeds     Instructions :
o   Peel and dice potatoes.  o   Sauté potatoes in sesame oil until lightly browned.  o   Add soy sauce, sugar, and water, simmer until potatoes are tender.  o   Garnish with sesame seeds and serve warm.    Garlic Bread
   Ingredients :
o   1 baguette  o   1/2 cup butter  o   4 cloves garlic  o   1/4 cup parsley  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  o   Slice baguette in half lengthwise.  o   Mix softened butter with minced garlic, chopped parsley, and salt.  o   Spread mixture on bread.  o   Bake for 10-15 minutes until golden.  o   Serve warm.    Gazpacho
   Ingredients :
o   4 tomatoes  o   1 cucumber  o   1 small red onion  o   1 bell pepper  o   2 cloves garlic  o   1/4 cup olive oil  o   2 tablespoons red wine vinegar  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   1/2 teaspoon pepper     Instructions :
o   Dice tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and bell pepper.  o   Blend vegetables with minced garlic, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper until
smooth.  o   Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.    Gigantes Plaki
   Ingredients :
o   2 cups giant beans  o   1 small onion  o   2 cloves garlic  o   4 tomatoes  o   1/4 cup olive oil  o   1 teaspoon oregano  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   1/2 teaspoon pepper     Instructions :
o   Soak beans overnight, then cook until tender.  o   Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened.  o   Add diced tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper, simmer for 10 minutes.  o   Mix beans with tomato sauce and transfer to a baking dish.  o   Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30 minutes.  o   Serve warm.    Goi Cuon (Spring Rolls)
   Ingredients :
o   1 package rice paper wrappers  o   1/2 pound shrimp  o   1/2 cup rice vermicelli  o   1/2 cup lettuce  o   1/4 cup mint  o   1/4 cup cilantro  o   1/4 cup basil  o   1/4 cup carrots  o   1/4 cup cucumber     Instructions :
o   Cook shrimp and slice in half.  o   Cook rice vermicelli according to package instructions, then drain.  o   Soak rice paper wrappers in warm water until pliable.  o   Place a small amount of shrimp, vermicelli, lettuce, mint, cilantro, basil, julienned
carrots, and cucumber on each wrapper.  o   Roll tightly and serve with dipping sauce.    Gomae (Spinach with Sesame Dressing)
   Ingredients :
o   1 bunch spinach  o   2 tablespoons sesame seeds  o   1 tablespoon soy sauce  o   1 tablespoon sugar  o   1 tablespoon mirin     Instructions :
o   Blanch spinach in boiling water, then rinse in cold water and squeeze out excess
moisture.  o   Toast sesame seeds and grind them.  o   Mix sesame seeds with soy sauce, sugar, and mirin.  o   Toss spinach with dressing and serve.    Gratin Dauphinois
   Ingredients :
o   4 potatoes  o   1 cup heavy cream  o   1/2 cup milk  o   2 cloves garlic  o   1/2 cup grated Gruyère cheese  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   1/2 teaspoon pepper     Instructions :
o   Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  o   Peel and thinly slice potatoes.  o   Rub a baking dish with a cut clove of garlic.
o   Layer potatoes in the dish, seasoning with salt and pepper.  o   Mix cream, milk, and minced garlic, pour over potatoes.  o   Sprinkle with grated Gruyère cheese.  o   Bake for 45 minutes until golden and bubbly.  o   Serve warm.    Greek Salad
   Ingredients :
o   4 tomatoes  o   1 cucumber  o   1 small red onion  o   1/4 cup olives  o   1/4 cup feta cheese  o   1/4 cup olive oil  o   2 tablespoons red wine vinegar  o   1 teaspoon oregano  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion.  o   Mix vegetables with olives and crumbled feta cheese.  o   Whisk olive oil, vinegar, oregano, and salt, then pour over salad.  o   Toss well and serve.    Green Bean Casserole
   Ingredients :
o   4 cups green beans  o   1 can cream of mushroom soup  o   1/2 cup milk  o   1 cup fried onions  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   1/2 teaspoon pepper     Instructions :
o   Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).  o   Cook green beans until tender.  o   Mix soup, milk, salt, and pepper in a baking dish.  o   Add green beans and half of the fried onions, stir to combine.  o   Bake for 25 minutes.  o   Top with remaining fried onions and bake for an additional 5 minutes.  o   Serve warm.    Guacamole
   Ingredients :
o   3 avocados  o   1 lime
o   1 small onion  o   2 tomatoes  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   1 tablespoon chopped cilantro  o   1 teaspoon minced garlic     Instructions :
o   Cut avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a bowl.  o   Mash the avocados with a fork.  o   Add lime juice, diced onion, chopped tomatoes, salt, cilantro, and garlic.  o   Mix well and serve immediately.    Gurkensalat (Cucumber Salad)
   Ingredients :
o   2 cucumbers  o   1/4 cup sour cream  o   2 tablespoons vinegar  o   1 tablespoon sugar  o   1 teaspoon dill  o   1 teaspoon salt     Instructions :
o   Slice cucumbers thinly.  o   Mix sour cream, vinegar, sugar, dill, and salt in a bowl.  o   Toss cucumbers with the dressing.  o   Serve chilled.    Gyeran Jjim
   Ingredients :
o   4 eggs  o   1 cup water  o   1/4 cup green onions  o   1 teaspoon salt  o   1/2 teaspoon sesame oil     Instructions :
o   Beat eggs with water, salt, and chopped green onions.  o   Pour mixture into a heatproof bowl.  o   Steam for 10-15 minutes until set.  o   Drizzle with sesame oil and serve warm.    Harira
   Ingredients :
o   1 cup lentils  o   1/2 cup chickpeas  o   1 small onion
